avalancheActivity.comment:
The early morning will see quite favourable conditions. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 3000 m, as well as at the base of rock walls.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach very large size in isolated cases. In isolated cases, the wet avalanches can reach an unusually long way from starting zones where no previous releases have taken place.
The avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found especially on very steep slopes above approximately 2400 m. These places are clearly recognisable to the trained eye.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day. The avalanche danger will increase during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Continuous warming to high altitudes. These spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The early morning will see quite favourable conditions, but the avalanche danger will increase later. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. This applies in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 3000 m, as well as at the base of rock walls.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach very large size in isolated cases. In very isolated cases, the wet avalanches can reach an unusually long way from starting zones where no previous releases have taken place.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather will be very warm. Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses.
In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers and reach large size.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment: Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. In particular on very steep sunny slopes moist avalanches can slide on the ground.
Backcountry tours and off-piste skiing should be started and concluded very early.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment: Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften earlier than the day before. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 3000 m.
